title: duendita Announces New Project, Shares New Song “Baby Teeth”: Listen
description: The soul singer’s A Strong Desire to Survive arrives via MIKE’s 10k
author: Nina Corcoran
excerpt: The soul singer’s A Strong Desire to Survive arrives via MIKE’s 10k
text: The soul singer’s A Strong Desire to Survive arrives via MIKE’s 10kNew York artist duendita has announced the new project A Strong Desire to Survive. It’s due out April 4 via MIKE’s label, 10k. Leading the project is the new song “Baby Teeth,” which ends with a sample of nine vocalists singing in harmony as a choir in duendita’s bedroom. “‘Baby Teeth’ celebrates the joy of healing from the darkest experiences,” explained duendita. “It’s a piano vocal banger about feeling safe and strong.” Give it a listen below.A Strong Desire to Survive will follow duendita’s 2024 EP, The Mind Is a Miracle, which featured the songs “Planetary” and “Born With Power.”Revisit the Rising interview “Meet duendita, a Spiritual Soul Singer Who Worships at the Altar of Self-Love.”A Strong Desire to Survive:01 Why I Didn’t Report02 Die Not03 Baby Teeth04 Break the Silence05 Cutie06 Fry07 Hammock08 Mind09 HTP (Healing the Pain)10 All Mine - June 11, 2019Nina Corcoran joined Pitchfork as an Associate Staff Writer in 2021 after contributing to the website since 2015. html:
The soul singer’s A Strong Desire to Survive arrives via MIKE’s 10k

New York artist duendita has announced the new project A Strong Desire to Survive. It’s due out April 4 via MIKE’s label, 10k. Leading the project is the new song “Baby Teeth,” which ends with a sample of nine vocalists singing in harmony as a choir in duendita’s bedroom. “‘Baby Teeth’ celebrates the joy of healing from the darkest experiences,” explained duendita. “It’s a piano vocal banger about feeling safe and strong.” Give it a listen below.

A Strong Desire to Survive will follow duendita’s 2024 EP, The Mind Is a Miracle, which featured the songs “Planetary” and “Born With Power.”

Revisit the Rising interview “Meet duendita, a Spiritual Soul Singer Who Worships at the Altar of Self-Love.”

A Strong Desire to Survive:

01 Why I Didn’t Report
02 Die Not
03 Baby Teeth
04 Break the Silence
05 Cutie
06 Fry
07 Hammock
08 Mind
09 HTP (Healing the Pain)
10 All Mine - June 11, 2019

Nina Corcoran joined Pitchfork as an Associate Staff Writer in 2021 after contributing to the website since 2015. She’s written for Rolling Stone, Wired, NPR, Stereogum, and elsewhere, and was previously the music editor of alt-weekly newspaper DigBoston. She’s based in Chicago. ... Read more
